means: [人名] [英格兰人姓氏] 埃米斯 Amis的变体

sentence.Network_en: A bit of charm and humour would not go amiss.
sentence.Network_cn: 人有点吸引力和幽默感总是好的。

sentence.Network_en: Something is radically amiss in our health care system.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们的保健制度存在重大缺陷。

sentence.Network_en: Their instincts warned them something was amiss.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们直觉上感到有什么地方不对劲儿。

jx.jx_en_mean: be offended by something that is said, especially through misinterpreting the intentions behind it

phrase.cizu_name: something would not go (或 come) amiss

jx.jx_en_mean: the specified thing would be welcome and useful

lj.lj_ly: you look as if a good meal wouldn't come amiss.
lj.lj_ls: 看你的样子好好吃一顿是合你意的。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English : probably from Old Norse ámis 'so as to miss', from á 'on' + mis (related to miss)

entry.tran: 不对的；不正常的；错误的
entry.def: If you say that something is amiss, you mean there is something wrong.

example.ex: Their instincts warned them something was amiss...
example.tran: 他们直觉上感到有什么地方不对劲儿。

example.ex: Something is radically amiss in our health care system.
example.tran: 我们的保健制度存在重大缺陷。

entry.tran: 会起作用；会称心如意；不会出错
entry.def: If you say that something would not go amiss or would not come amiss, you mean that it would be pleasant and useful.

example.ex: A bit of charm and humour would not go amiss...
example.tran: 人有点吸引力和幽默感总是好的。

example.ex: The cracks are showing in the walls and a lick of paint would not come amiss.
example.tran: 墙面开始出现裂缝了，刷一点油漆就能补好。

means.word_mean: 1. away from the correct or expected course;

sentences.sentence: "something has gone awry in our plans"
"something went badly amiss in the preparations"

means.word_mean: 2. in an improper or mistaken or unfortunate manner;

sentences.sentence: "if you think him guilty you judge amiss"
"no one took it amiss when she spoke frankly"

means.word_mean: 3. in an imperfect or faulty way;

sentences.sentence: "Miss Bennet would not play at all amiss if she practiced more"- Jane Austen

auth_sentence.content: Your brain, however, knows something is amiss.
auth_sentence.res_content: Your brain, however, knows something is amiss.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Your brain, however, knows something is amiss.

auth_sentence.content: That shortfall suggests that something is amiss at Tulane.
auth_sentence.res_content: That shortfall suggests that something is amiss at Tulane.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: That shortfall suggests that something is amiss at Tulane.

auth_sentence.content: They know when something is amiss in this district.
auth_sentence.res_content: They know when something is amiss in this district.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: They know when something is amiss in this district.

sentences.en: She sensed something was amiss right now!
sentences.cn: 她觉得有点不对头，就叫了警察。

sentences.en: There was nothing amiss that I could see.
sentences.cn: 我看不出来有什么不恰当的地方。

sentences.en: A little luck wouldn’t go amiss right now!
sentences.cn: 现在要是交点好运倒也不错！

sentences.en: A little luck wouldn’t go amiss right now!
sentences.cn: 现在要是交点好运倒也不错！

sentences.en: Nothing comes amiss to a hungry man.

means.word_mean: (可能因误会)对…生气；因…而见怪

sentences.en: Please don’t take it amiss if I venture to point out your errors.
sentences.cn: 假如我冒昧指出你的错误,请不要见怪。

sentences.en: His joke was taken amiss by some of the company.
sentences.cn: 他开玩笑的话使几个朋友不高兴。
